titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Alexander Willson, Indictment
CWG11196

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Taylor Circuit Court
March Term 1862
Commonwealth Plaintiff
Against } Indict selling spiritious Liquors to minors
Alexander Willson Defendant

This day Came the attorney for the Commonwealth and the defendant filed a demurrer to the Indictment which being duly Considered, the same is overruled to which the deft excepted the deft then plead not guilty and thereupon the following jurors towit Cy Parrott, W H Peterson, Jno Cloyd C. S. Robinson, Chas Wright, Robt Dearen Crofford Thomas, Wm L Davis, S. W Bowles Wm Fawcett & J. B. Beams were sworn to try the issue, after hearing the evidence rendered the following verdict towit "We of the jury find the Deft guilty of the offence charged in the Indictment and assess his fine at Fifty dollars. Wm Fawcett one of the jury

It is therefore adjudged by the Court that the defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of Fifty dollars for selling spiritious liquors to minors, also the costs herein expended and may be taken &c

A Copy
Geo. W. Montague clk
Taylor Circuit Court
